items.title: Police Chase Driver Across Southern California Until She Escapes Into Mexico
items.summary: The woman stole a minivan, police said, beginning a dramatic pursuit that spanned four counties and reached speeds of 90 miles per hour.

items.title: The NYC Demographic Trends That Shaped Mamdani’s Win
items.summary: Moderate Black voters and young progressives favored Zohran Mamdani for mayor, while Andrew Cuomo won many wealthy New Yorkers and those who voted for Donald Trump.

items.title: Dismantled by DOGE, a Foreign Policy Center Finds New Life
items.summary: The Kennan Institute, which researches Russia and the surrounding region, has re-emerged in a form that is smaller but more impervious to government control.

items.title: For Trump, Nothing Was Off Limits During the Shutdown
items.summary: President Trump pressured Democrats by taking punishing actions no previous administration ever took during a shutdown.

items.title: Shutdown Deal Revives Democratic Infighting
items.summary: The agreement prompted a backlash within the party, not only against the Democratic defectors who supported it, but against Senator Chuck Schumer, the leader who did not.

items.title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Overturn Verdict in E. Jean Carroll Case
items.summary: The president said the assertions behind a judgment that he sexually abused and defamed the writer were “implausible” and “unsubstantiated.”

items.title: Can Donald Trump sue the BBC for $1bn and which party would win?
items.summary: <p>US president has said he will bring proceedings if the documentary containing an edited speech from 6 January 2021 is not retracted</p><p>Donald Trump has grabbed the headlines after threatening to sue the BBC for $1bn (£760m) for what the corporation has accepted was a misleading edit of his speech on 6 January 2021 during the Capitol Hill insurrection. Here the Guardian examines the US president’s potential path to bringing and winning a libel claim.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/11/can-donald-trump-sue-bbc-which-party-would-win">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Senate approves deal to end shutdown with Democrats riven by splits – US politics live
items.summary: <p>Deal will now head to the House but many in the Democrats are enraged with colleagues who supported the measure, and with minority leader Chuck Schumer</p><p>Donald Trump has threatened to sue the BBC for $1bn (£760m) after accusations that the corporation was failing in its duty of impartiality over the editing of the US president’s speech on 6 January 2021 for a Panorama programme.</p><p>Lawyers for the US president said that the BBC must retract the Panorama documentary by Friday or face a lawsuit for “no less” than $1bn, according to reports. The BBC has confirmed it had received a letter and said it will respond in due course.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/11/donald-trump-us-government-shutdown-senate-democrats-republicans-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>
